> I have to admit that =
I thought I had seen the worst 'paranormal'
show on television already. I w=
as wrong. Door to the Dead has exceeded
my worst expectations.
> =A0
> Gene=
rally, I respect John Oliver's work as a medium. While I have no
personal e=
xperience with him, in the past he has looked and acted more
genuine than n=
ot, the rolling of the eyes put aside for the moment.
> =A0
> I do take exc=
eption to the characterization of the talking box as an
Edison device. I ha=
ve documented the history of Edison, ITC and
EVP=A0=A0elsewhere. This is ho=
wever the smallest concern I have with this
show.
> =A0
> Prior to wathcing=
 I had just had a conversation with a respected
colleague on the West coast=
 regarding interesting phenomena he and
others are constantly observing in =
sites with phenomena similar to
that on Door to the Dead. None of those mea=
surements were made by this
team. The use of thermal in this situation is n=
ot indicated as well.
> =A0
> The real concern is that no attempt was made =
to help this family in
a broader context. The skeptic did and said nothing =
skeptical as far
as I could tell. Key questions were not asked (at least on=
-camera)
that would reveal the psycho-dynamics of this family. We know fair=
ly
well at this time that PK phenomena is often centered on a focal
person =
who can exhibit specific characteristics. That the team seems
unaware of th=
is is quite disturbing to a person like myself.
> =A0
> A real research opp=
ortunity was lost in this case, as was an
opportunity to educate the public=
 on the right way to approach such
situations. Continually sending the mess=
ages that phenomena is based
on 'demons' and 'spirits' exclusively does not=
hing to further the
position of serious investigators, which is perhaps mos=
t troubling of all.
